channel.title: Quick Question
channel.description: So I'm going to buy the whole Soprano's series. I'm probably going to buy a blu-ray player but was wondering if the 360 with and HDMI cable would make a noticeable quality difference.

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Or you just stream bluray through computer to xbox

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Have you seen a 1080pi TV playing Blu-Ray? Such a difference it’s sexy.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

cows_be_sacred:

But I don’t need the extra functions. $100 less

BUT YOU WANT TO FUCKING PLAY HIGH DEF CONTENT WITH BLU RAY DISCS. THAT’S THE EXTRA FUCNTION.

In my opinion high definition is rather pointless. I don’t see why you should pay almost double the price for a blu-ray disc than a dvd.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:7, topic:331858”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=428239.msg3144480#msg3144480 date=1267927993]

what?? xbox cant play blurays

No, I have an xbox 360 with an hdmi cable and was hoping it would make the quality better, so I don’t have to spend $200 on a blu-ray player.

bluray is high definition, dvd isnt… theres a massive difference

I understand that but was wondering if I used a regular dvd-cd and an HDMI cable would it make a difference?
[/quote]
compared to dvd without hdmi, possibly, depends on what you’re using right now. component is generally good quality too and if you’re already using something digital then you wont see a difference

compared to bluray, there will be a huge difference[/quote]
Yeah I might as well buy the player

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:6, topic:331858”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=428239.msg3144434#msg3144434 date=1267926662]

what?? xbox cant play blurays

No, I have an xbox 360 with an hdmi cable and was hoping it would make the quality better, so I don’t have to spend $200 on a blu-ray player.

bluray is high definition, dvd isnt… theres a massive difference
[/quote]
I understand that but was wondering if I used a regular dvd-cd and an HDMI cable would it make a difference?[/quote]
compared to dvd without hdmi, possibly, depends on what you’re using right now. component is generally good quality too and if you’re already using something digital then you wont see a difference

compared to bluray, there will be a huge difference
